title: Ok, Boots of Swiftness are now a total joke...
body:
Right now they only give 10 more Movement speed than other boots. 

Why should anyone get them over Mercury Treads now? 
Just remove them or rework them already, because with the last barrage of nerfs, they just became a noob trap.

Right. So that's why Boots of Swiftness are good. There's only about 30 champions in the game that actually don't have slows. And you're facing 5 champions, some with multiple slows or slows on short cooldowns. 

Merc Treads makes the slows shorter, but Swiftness matters the moment that they hit you.
EDIT: Also brand's ~~passive~~ Ult has  a short slow now :o
Brand's passive doesn't have a slow, but his ultimate does.
What's the difference between slow resist and tenacity though? Swiftness has 25% slow resist while Mercury has 30% tenacity, which also applies to stuns and such on top of slows.

> [{quoted}](name=Blackstone01,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ueR603En,comment-id=00020005,timestamp=2016-06-02T16:42:34.665+0000)
>
> What's the difference between slow resist and tenacity though? Swiftness has 25% slow resist while Mercury has 30% tenacity, which also applies to stuns and such on top of slows.

Tenacity is duration, resist is potency.

ex: let's say you get hit by a 70% slow for 2 seconds.

Merc Treads makes that a 70% slow for 1.4 seconds.

Boots of Swiftness makes it a 45% slow for 2 seconds.

Correction, Boots of swiftness makes it 52.5%, it doesn't subtract from the percentage it's multiplicative, tho the percent reduction is additive tho which is why you can get 100% slow reduction with storm raiders + swiftness
Tenacity reduces duration, resist reduces effectiveness. Resist is far more powerful when it comes to slows, which are applied often and repeatedly.
Ah, so slow resist would reduce the slow % by 25%?
25% of the slow percent, IIRC, but yes.
Merc tread's is 300g more for 35% tenacity and 25 MR soo....

> [{quoted}](name=Tysmin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ueR603En,comment-id=0011000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-02T19:52:46.849+0000)
>
> it specifically says it reduces the duration of slows in the tooltip

Reducing the effectiveness of slows is a more valuable effect when dealing with slows, especially when you also get more movespeed at a cheaper price. Reducing duration of slows often doesn't provide any usefulness at all when items like Rylai's and IBG exist allowing for reapplication of slows well before they fall off.
if you are being hit by rylai's then the tenacity and MR make it better I would rather have a harder slow for a shorter time than a slightly weaker slow for a longer time.

> [{quoted}](name=Tysmin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ueR603En,comment-id=001100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-02T19:57:25.739+0000)
>
> if you are being hit by rylai's then the tenacity and MR make it better I would rather have a harder slow for a shorter time than a slightly weaker slow for a longer time.

It doesn't matter if the duration is reduced, they'll still reapply it before it wears off. In that situation swifties are more likely to let you get away than merc treads because you will be moving faster with swifties.

Merc Treads reduce how long the slow is in effect.

Boots of Swiftness reduce the **effectiveness **of the slow (how strong it is).
that is correct however the amount of tenacity it gives is an all around better because you won't be slowed for as long and it reduces the effectiveness of all other types of cc
Frozen mallet or Ash will keep you slowed for the same amount forever. Swifties grant overall more movespeed plus no magic damage is being applied requiring mitigation.

It was strong, so you bought it. It was strong, so other people bought it. It was strong, so they nerfed it.

Allowing him to reach the higher 500s of MS which is a tad bit too much for an ADC. Boots of swiftness was great on people who lacked sufficient MS from ALL sources.
